heading: research study
description: By employing the guerrilla design tactics I learned from the Udacity UX Design Course, I quickly managed to plan and conduct this research study for an online whisky shop project.

heading: define & ideate
description: In Miro, I used the affinity mapping technique to define the design problems and opportunities. I then moved into ideation with sketching techniques like Crazy-8 and Rapid Ideation. Finally prioritizing ideas with Idea Mapping and Value vs Complexity Quadrant.

heading: prototype
description:
A lo-fi feature prototype for the whisky shop project made with Figma. The user's goal is to add a Sample Vial of a product of choice to the shopping cart and close the confirmation pop-up box.

User journey:
1. Enter the New Temptations page.
2. Select a product.
3. Navigate to Product Details page.
4. Add a Sample Vial to the cart.
5. Close the confirmation pop-up box.

heading: usability test
description: By conducting moderate usability studies with five respondents, I was able to identify the issues to the design and continue the design iterations with further ideation and prototyping.
